page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content:
WE TALKED TO A PENSIONER IN THE VILLAGE ABOUT WHAT A VILLAGE WAS LIKE IN THE EARLY 1900'S. IN THE 1930'S{CARS}WERE JUST BECOMING POPULAR. FARMS WERE JUST USING{TRACTORS INSTEAD OF HORSES,AND HORSES WERE QUITE UNPOPULAR. IN FACT,THERE ARE{MORE}HORSES AROUND IN 1985,THAN THERE WERE IN THE 1930'S. HORSES ARE NOW USED FOR PLEASURE INSTEAD OF WORK. { {RADIO'S}WERE JUST INVENTED IN THE EARLY 1900'S,AND THE FIRST RADIO WAS CALLED THE{"CATS WHISKER".}AT THESE TIMES TO LISTEN TO THE RADIO YOU HAD TO WEAR HEADPHONES.
BREAD WAS DELIVERED TO THE DIFFERENT HOUSES,AND THERE WERE A LOT MORE PUBS.
